description.narrative: Kordsa Global Endustriyel Iplik ve Kord Bezi Sanayi ve Ticaret A.S. (Kordsa or the Sponsor), a former IFC client, is the worlds leading producer of nylon and polyester yarns, cord and industrial fabric mainly used in automotive tires, rubber parts, and transmission and conveyor belts. Kordsa has 11 manufacturing plants located in 9 countries. The proposed investment in the South American subsidiaries of Kordsa entails providing two separate corporate loans to Kordsa Argentina S.A. (Kordsa Argentina) and Kordsa Brasil S.A. (Kordsa Brasil), to be utilized for refinancing part of their existing debt, working capital requirements and maintenance capital expenditures (collectively the Project).

The Project will have significant development impacts: IFC's investments in Kordsa Brasil and Kordsa Argentina will benefit the manufacturing cluster in both countries, and particularly in the case of Brazil, in a frontier region of the country, where employment opportunities are limited. Employment preservation: By strengthening the capital structure of the companies, IFC's investment will help retain jobs and assist the companies emerge from the crisis as more viable entities. Continued know-how and technology transfer: Given the Sponsor's focus on product innovation and its ability to meet stringent quality standards, the Project is expected to result in continued technology and know-how transfer to the subsidiaries in terms of manufacturing and quality processes.
